subject: HINDI

notes.descrlong: No prior background in language is required.

description: Designed for students who are complete beginners in the Hindi language. Students  enter this course with no or very little prior knowledge in Hindi. The course aims to help students acquire competence in the four skills (Listening, Speaking, Reading & Writing)  of the Hindi language by utilizing tools of basic grammar, vocabulary, cultural points and other oral and written activities. By the end of this course, students are able to communicate in basic everyday Hindi, and perform all the hands-on tasks and functions necessary to survive in India and/or similar context.

subject: HINDI

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: HINDI 1102 or permission of instructor. After pre-enrollment please contact Sujata Singh (ss596) to enroll.

description: This is an intermediate-level course in Hindi. Students' competence in all four language areas will become very strong and solid. This course will work on building up their confidence in describing complicated situations and ideas in the target language, improve their ability to read and write with better flow and accuracy, and increase their listening comprehension to more detailed and complicated materials.

subject: HINDI

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: HINDI 2202 or permission of instructor. After pre-enrollment please contact Sujata Singh (ss596) to enroll.

description: Selected readings in modern Hindi literature. Continued work on fluency in speaking Hindi on an advanced level. There will be a combination of different reading materials from literature, journals, newspapers, and many social, entertainment, and political magazines in Hindi. Discussions will be based on those readings and articles, hence giving opportunities to express views and opinions in a fluent and effective manner.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: HINDI 2202 or permission of instructor.

subject: HINDI

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite:  HINDI 1101 or permission of instructor.

description: Designed for students who have either completed one semester of Hindi at Cornell or demonstrate same level of competency in Hindi. By the end of this course, students are able to communicate in basic everyday Hindi, and perform all the hands-on tasks and functions necessary to survive in India and/or similar context.

description: HINDI 2202 is the continuation of HINDI 2201. The main emphasis in this course is to reinforce  the linguistic functions learned in HINDI 2201, and to build comparatively more complex functions suitable for intermediate level in Hindi. Students' competence in all four language skills will be improved in order to perform higher level tasks and function.

subject: HINDI
titleShort: Int. Hindi Rdg/Wrtg Hrtg Std I
titleLong: Intermediate Hindi Reading and Writing for Heritage Students I

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: HINDI 1102 or equal level of competency or permission of instructor.

description: Throughout this course sequence all aspects of language learning are practiced; listening, speaking, reading, and writing. Video materials are used and the emphasis is on the conversational aspect of the language.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: HINDI 1102 or equal level of competency or permission of instructor.

subject: HINDI
titleLong: Hindi Service Learning and Language Immersion

notes.descrlong: Taught in Varanasi, India.

description: A total of six weeks community-based, service learning Hindi immersion course will be offered in the late Fall '15 semester. The students enrolled in this course will acquire all four skills - speaking, reading, writing and listening in Hindi from volunteering in the local community and daily language instruction. Three weeks of language instruction on Cornell campus will be a strong introduction to the later three weeks of community engaged intensive Hindi immersion in India over winter break. It will be open to students from diverse disciplines across Cornell University and the course will be designed to accommodate students from all levels.
